DOC.brief_title: Effects Consuming Sugar-Sweetened Beverages With Meals 10 Weeks
DOC.detailed_description: The study design prospective , blind diet intervention study participant consume either fructose- glucose-sweetened beverage ( 25 % energy ) meal . Experimental procedure , include 24-hour serial blood sampling , 26-h stable isotoped infusion , post-heparin blood collection , gluteal biopsy , metabolic rate monitoring , compute tomography scan abdomen , Oral Glucose Tolerance Disposal Tests , perform baseline end 10-week intervention period UC Davis School Medicine/Sacramento Veterans Affairs Medical Center Clinical Research Center ( CCRC ) . During 2-week inpatient baseline period , subject serve energy balance diet contain 15 % energy protein , 30 % fat , 55 % complex carbohydrate . Following baseline period , subject reside home 8 week consume usual ad libitum diet along 25 % energy requirement fructose- glucose-sweetened beverage . Subjects return CCRC 2-week inpatient intervention period end study serve energy-balanced diet contain 15 % energy protein , 30 % fat , 30 % complex carbohydrate 25 % energy fructose- glucose-sweetened beverage .
DOC.criteria: Selfreport stable body weight Women postmenopausal base selfreport menstruation least one year evidence diabetes renal hepatic disease fast serum TG concentration > 400 mg/dl hypertension ( > 140/90 mg Hg ) surgery weight loss individual smoke report exercise 3.5 hours/week level vigorous walk use thyroid , lipidlowering , glucoselowering , antihypertensive , antidepressant , weight loss medication habitual ingestion one sugarsweetened beverage/day two alcoholic beverages/day
